description.narrative: To strengthen community organizing processes, agricultural production and livestock management projects and advocate in improving health and education for indigenous members of 50 communities from San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango. It will support 550 direct beneficiaries and indirectly 6,350 community members through the implementation of coffee production, training workshops and technical assistance for family backyard gardens and support in health and education. This grant is to improve livelihood conditions in rural communities in San Martin Jilotepeque, build knowledge and skills and create more access to health and education services, building the local economy

participating-org.narrative: Asociacion para la Promocion de la Salud y el Desarrollo Socio Economico
